Kia Optima 0-60 times

Autotk.com offers accurate information on Kia Optima 0-60 times and quarter mile from trusted sources. You may also keep track of how 0-60 times of Kia Optima changed across years and check out the model’s competitors with the same acceleration performance.

Our mission is to present an easy-to-read and comprehensive information on Kia Optima 0-60 mph and quarter mile for the devoted geeks, as it is an essential indicator of the vehicle power.

The Kia Optima is offered with two 2.0-liter gasoline engines and a 1.7-liter diesel. The entry-level gasoline engine delivers 163 hp and develops a maximum torque of 196 Nm at 4800 rpm. The stronger second petrol engine, thanks to turbocharger, has a power output of 245 hp and a torque of 350 Nm already in the range from 1350 rpm. The weaker petrol engine is only available with a 6-speed manual gearbox, the stronger with a 6-speed automatic transmission. The diesel has 1.7-liter displacement and develops a power of 141 hp. Between 1750 and 2500 revolutions a decent torque of 340 Nm is available. Only the diesel can be optionally combined with a manual 6-speed manual gearbox or a seven-speed double clutch transmission.

In addition, a plug-in hybrid version with a 2.0-liter gasoline engine and a total output of 205 hp is now also available. According to the manufacturer, the car can drive 54 kilometers purely electrically and according to standard only 1.6 liters on (the first) 100 kilometers consume. The hybrid is available only with 6-speed automatic transmission.

Thanks to its regular running culture and fuel economy, the diesel is the best choice for the Optima. It shows a small turbocharger at start-up and gets grumpy at higher speeds. Thanks to its low fuel consumption and its large tank, however, reachable distances of over 1200 kilometers are easily accessible. The 7-speed dual clutch transmission is a good addition to a comfortable drive. It turns off perfectly and keeps the revs at a low level. The consumption of 4.4 liters by standard can not reach the Optima however. Under real conditions, however, it is still satisfactory 5.1 to 6.2 liters per 100 kilometers.

In contrast to its first editions, the modern generation of Kia Optima models are quite competitive vehicles able to make a run from zero to 60 in under 7 seconds. Over the years, Optima has been confused with Hyundai Sonata living in the shadow of its parent auto. But 2016 Kia Optima is more of its own car than ever before pushing the boundaries of the mid-sized sedans. Since 2001, when the model was introduced, Kia Optima has drastically improved its 0-60 times. 

On the highest trim level, Kia Optima SX Turbo 4dr Sedan produces 245 hp and 260 lb.-ft of torque at 6000 rpm boasting of an impressive 0-60 times of 6.8 seconds. In addition to the 2-litre turbocharged engine Kia offers 2.4-liter naturally aspirated four-cylinder motor on the base and 1.6-liter turbocharged engine aimed at fuel economy. The recent update resulted in a better feedback and an improved steering feel with the price tag still very attractive. 

CarAndDriver Test Result

  • - Zero to 60 mph: 7.5 sec
  • - Zero to 100 mph: 20.4 sec
  • - Rolling start, 5-60 mph: 7.7 sec
  • - Top gear, 30-50 mph: 3.9 sec
  • - Top gear, 50-70 mph: 5.1 sec
  • - Standing ¼-mile: 15.9 sec @ 90 mph
  • - Top speed (C/D est): 135 mph
  • - Braking, 70-0 mph: 179 ft
  • - Roadholding, 300-ft-dia skidpad: 0.83 g
